meanings.definition: To restore or reinstate a monarch to their throne.
meanings.sent1: The people cheered as the rightful king was reenthroned after years in exile.
meanings.sent2: The queen was reenthroned after the revolution ended.
meanings.sent3: The royal cat demanded to be reenthroned on the highest cushion in the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun reenthrones itself in the sky each morning, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: The melody reenthrones itself in my mind, playing on repeat.

meanings.definition: To restore or reinstate someone to a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The board unanimously decided to reenthrones the CEO after the successful merger.
meanings.sent2: The general was reenthroned as the leader of the army.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to reenthrones itself as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Confidence reenthrones a person in their rightful place of influence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind words reenthroned the student's self-esteem.
